info.title: Unicorn
info.address: Adlington Rd, Wilmslow SK9 2LN, United Kingdom

data.text: Quite possibly the worst meal I’ve ever had, arrived with my wife and mother in law the place was cold, no heating what so ever. We all had the roast beef Sunday dinner which must have come straight from the freezer and of low quality. Mother in law had coffee just to warm up but again must have forgot to put the coffee in. Don’t normally leave reviews but on this occasion made the effort. Needless to say we won’t be visiting this place again.
data.name: Tony John Watson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Tony we are really sorry that you didn’t enjoy your visit, unfortunately the table you sat at is right infront of the main entrance so with the door opening and closing you will feel a draft, if we can do anything to rectify your visit please call us.

data.text: Nice pub with a countryside feel. Very friendly staff!
data.name: Josephine Preece
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars josephine:)

data.text: It was  my first and sadly last visit.  Booked it for a special birthday!!  The  food was unbelievably awful, 3 had a Sunday dinner, was clearly microwaved, parts of the food were really dry and hard so was inedible, the worst roasties, stuffing, veg, and meat we've all had.  The chicken ham pie,  again microwaved,  pastry,  soft and soggy, the filling was very nice though.  The desserts were nice at least.  The place was empty and the server kept forgetting to come back to take our order.
data.name: Karen Coleman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Karen we are sorry you didn’t have a pleasant experience with us, we pride ourselves on standards and this is really disappointing. If there is anything we can do to rectify this please call us.

data.text: We go regularly to the Unicorn to support the Pub as there never seems to be many people there and although it's quite dark inside on good weather days it does attract people to the outside area which is a lovely area again we think the inside needs updating its dark and not very welcoming sorry to say this but we wonder whether this is the reason there never seems to be many customers inside, we tend to go in on a Saturday evening rather than in the week.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 4 stars Peter, we hope to have an investment at some point to improve the decor of the pub.

data.text: Was served by Hannah who did an amazing job making sure our food was fantastic. The service at the bar also didn't fail to disappoint with a wide range of ales available. Would go again!

data.text: I took my mum here last night after her radiotherapy session to keep her spirits up. I had no idea that The Unicorn really had a magic about the place. Hannah recognised my mum from just one previous visit and came rushing out to give her the warmest hug and made her the most incredible drink of water mixed with fruits (my mum is off her food, but this drink she lapped up). Hannah then went about organising some of the celebs that were in that night to come and have their photo taken with my mum, which they obliged with full enthusiasm and kudos to these guys for taking the time out of their evening to blast a massive bolt of joy at my mum. The real stars though were Hannah and Molly who showed us real magic of human kindness. This is no ordinary place!
data.name: Peter Williams
data.responseFromOwnerText: Wow Peter what an amazing review, thank you so much for taking the time to leave your kind words, I will pass this on to Hannah and Molly. See you soon :)

data.text: Great pub with a huge beer garden half of it covered . Food is lovely. Proper pub grub at a great price. Two full size meals from the pub classic menu for £14.69. Makes a change from the overpriced Wilmslow centre eateries. Fantastic value for money. Friendly and helpful staff. They even have monthly tribute band afternoons on a Wednesday for £13.50 including a meal. Not been to one yet but I'll be giving it a go. Well recommended 👍👍

data.text: We go, or should I say went to the Unicorn fairly regularly. Our last two meals have been poor. Last Thursday we went for the steak night, we both asked for medium rare, but the steaks were so thin and poor quality, it would have been difficult to cook them medium rare, both steaks were sirloin and very fatty and over cooked. We have had steaks in the past and they were much thicker and much better quality and very good. The man who served us asked if we enjoyed the food, when we said no, he lost interest and walked away, which was disappointing. So sadly we will be avoiding the Unicorn in future.
data.name: Bill Bennett
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi bill, I’m sorry your steaks were not up to the quality they normally are. We will feed this back to our supplier, if you could supply some more information regarding who the person was who you told about your steaks maybe we can resolve this as the manager on duty wasn’t made aware of anything. Please email me at 6252@greeneking.co.uk

Excellent food and excellent value. We are regulars, but for the first time the gents’ lavatory floor was wet and smelt strongly of urine.
Used the disabled lavatory, but lavatory paper dispenser was locked, but the short end of a roll balanced on the top sufficed.
Didn’t spoil a happy birthday event, but I didn’t expect this. Has been many years since I regularly came across this in pubs.

data.text: I haven't been for a number of years, but it has been extended several times and they have made a nice job of it, they had a reasonable selection of beer/ales I had an IPA well kept, we stopped by on our way back home to Macclesfield so we placed our order 1 kids sausage and chips with sweet corn (10 chips, 2 sausage, corn on the cob) the sausage were nice, my wife ordered chickpea curry (balti dish of the curry a naan bread, and a poppadom very nice) I ordered the Katsu curry chicken the chicken itself was nicely done however for some reason it arrived drowned in a cheap chip shop curry sauce with a strong thickener background flavour, and oddly enough chips were added to the dish 🤔 the dish was spoiled by both chips and the substitute sauce, the rice was nice so being very hungry I separated the offending items (see pic) we were asked if the meal was ok and I explained that mine was not and we had eaten in Wetherspoons the night before and my wife had their Katsu curry and it was far better, I was offered something else but I declined as it was late for lunch and we wanted to get home, we would eat there again but I would choose something different.
data.name: austin stott
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Austin, we are really pleased you love our little pub. We are a little confused of the comments regarding our katsu curry, the menu states it’s served with rice and chips. We haven’t ever had a negative comment regarding the curry sauce but we will feed this back. Thanks again see you soon :)

data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Helen I’m sorry you didn’t enjoy your visit today. We are abit confused regarding the review, upon arrival you was told about the wait on food and also offered free coffees as an apology for the food taking 5 minutes more than you was stated. We explained the team member made a mistake and we rectified the pizza straight away. Unfortunately we cook all our vegetables Al dente, we did do a check back and no issues were raised. I’m happy to try and rectify the visit if you want to call and discuss, Many thanks.

data.text: A lovely pub but disappointed on this occasion. I visited last night with two friends for a drink and chat. We had to ask the waitress to clean the table as it was so sticky which she did but was still sticky . Considering it is open till 11pm we were surprised that the ladies toilet was not in use just after 10pm as it had been cleaned and told to use the disabled toilet then when we went to order coffees were told that the coffee machine had been cleaned and turned off. We felt as though as there weren’t many in and we were the only females the staff just wanted us to go. I thought if the place was open till 11pm then it was ok to order coffees and go to the toilet. Obviously not here.

data.text: We stumbled across this place on a day out and decided to go in for a meal as the place looked lovely from the outside, the place itself was ok but the food certainly wasn't,  one starter was good although it was served with normal sliced toasted bread, usually you see a speciality bread especially with a baked camembert,  the other starter was salt and pepper squid, the batter was so soggy it was making me feel a bit sickly so had to scrape it off, but the squid itself was nice and tender, then came the main meals, the 'signature' hunters chicken was described as chicken wrapped in bacon on a gammon steak,  what we got was a gammon steak hiding a tiny piece of chicken breast underneath, presumably the chef was so embarrassed by it he placed it like that to hide the pitiful chicken,  it did taste nice though and there was plenty of everything else on the plate, the other 'signature' meal looked good but all was cold, only the corn cobs were slightly warm, they did heat it back up for me but the whole dish (chicken thighs) was not anything to rave about, all just mediocre,  nothing 'signature' about any of it, then came desert, what took our fancy was the Belgium waffle with banana and butterscotch ice cream served with caramalised banana with a chocolate and caramel sauce, yummy,  what came was a small cold waffle (which we were assured was put in the microwave, so can only guess they forgot to actually turn it on) with a blob of VANILLA ice cream and a raw banana cut lengthways still cold from the fridge with a small drizzle of chocolate sauce, all extremely basic,  when my girlfriend quizzed about whether the desert was correct for what we ordered they said yes, she said that's how they do caramelised banana, it was clear they hadn't spent one second in a pan so not sure how the caramelised process works at this place 🤔, there was no excuse for the ice cream but the sauce was a delivery issue apparently,  the 'manager',who at first forgot she was the manager but remembered she was after returning from going to look for the manager, did minus the desert from the bill and did kind of apologise in her own way but you could tell she really didn't want to. All in all not a very good experience and shall not be returning any time soon...
data.name: Kev Foxcroft
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi We are sorry to hear this. After speaking to the team. They have explained to me that they checked back with your meal. They was told everything was okay other than the meal that was replaced. The girl you approached at the bar was a front of house team member and not a manager. You then spoke to the assistant manager who refunded your meal for you. I hope this clears things up for you. If you would like to discuss further then I would be happy to speak with you Please call the pub if you wish to discuss further 01625 528359 We hope to see you visit again soon Thank you Team unicorn

data.text:
In short, not enough staff resulting in long wait times and the 4 different meals which our table ordered were either undercooked or very dry.  For people looking for a sports pub for a drink and a catch up, it might be alright. But unless there's a change in ownership or management we won't be returning and wouldn't recommend for a meal.

On arrival, there's plenty of parking, all tables are well spaced and there's an area for check-in (for COVID restrictions). After that not a single staff member wore any masks or visors. There was a single one-way sticker on the floor as you enter and no other directions regarding how to navigate through the building so was a bit of a free for all. There's plenty of choice on the menu and the prices look pretty reasonable. We ordered 6 meals, 4 different dishes and we waited for well over 90 minutes, probably because they only had a small number of waiting staff working. I had the Chick Pea Curry Banquet which was OK at best and the bhajis were undercooked with uncooked batter in them. The naan was hard in parts as though it was stale, other than that it was alright. Other people had Sunday roasts which they said the meat was dry and the majority was left. Inside the decor was dated and not in a quaint way.  The men's toilets were also extremely filthy and the smell was awful, it was clear they hadn't been cleaned in a while.  The atmosphere inside was definitely old pub style with sports on the TV and 90s music playing the whole time.

data.text: First and last time visiting the Unicorn. Food was ok but the service was pretty bad. Asked for the Burger Deal with the Punk IPA. I received the Greene King IPA. Gammon and Eggs was also ordered with coffee. The Coffee was then included with the Burger deal and full price for the IPA was charged. A third separate burger deal was ordered with the Punk IPA - Greene King IPA was received. Once we had ordered we were not spoken to again and the only thanks we received was printed on the receipt that proved the devious way they charged extra.
data.name: Rae Leeson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi. Thanks for taking the time to leave a review although we apologise it was under such circumstances. Punk IPA is not included in the burger deal, it is the Greene King IPA. When ordering a meal deal, the cheapest drink will be included as the deal. If a pint of IPA is ordered alongside a coffee in a meal deal the coffee will be discounted. The above is company and till process and not something the team have control over. It is also clearly outlined in the terms which are available on the menu. We are more than willing to discuss this further so if you would like to contact the pub on 01625528351 asking for a duty manager then please feel free to do so.

data.text: Sadly whilst there are always friendly staff, they always fall down in one area or another. I keep going back but the food is hit and miss. I was served under cooked chicken last time.
data.name: GRP0500642 Interserve
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi. Thanks for leaving us this review. We are sorry to hear that you felt your chicken was undercooked, however we would like to reassure you and all our customers that all our meat products are cooked to a minimum of 75 degrees and probe tested 3/4 times before they leave the kitchen. If you would like to discuss this further, please contact us on 01625 528351 asking for the Duty Manager.

data.text:
This pub has its ups and downs. Our recent visit was very enjoyable with good service, gos drinks abd a gpod looking menu.
Our previous visit was also ok if a little crowded with noisy locals who filled the bar area and made us feel a little unwelcome.
We used to visit more often but we avoided the venue for 6 months last year after ordering a posh fish fingers sandwich and being served birds eye breaded cod on cheap white bread.  ...
